actions: Nourishes the Blood, nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin, nourishes Jing and Blood and fills the Marrow.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold and stops pain due to Blood Stasis.
With Shu Di Huang, for Heat symptoms due to Yin Deficiency and Devastated Blood.
Nourishes the Blood and astringes Yin.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
With Shu Di Huang and Dang Gui, for dizziness, blurred vision, and dysmenorrhea due to Blood Deficiency or Stasis.
With Shu Di Huang, Mai Men Dong and Dang Gui, for Tinnitus, dizziness, blurred vision, numbness of the extremities, and muscle spasms due to Liver Yin Deficiency.
Nourishes the Yin, clears the Heart and eliminates irritability.
Tonifies the Kidneys, astringes Jing and stops diarrhea and spermatorrhea, quiets the Spirit and calms and tonifies and contains Heart Qi.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.
Tonifies the Spleen and Stomach, augments Qi, nourishes the Blood, calms the Spirit and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.

manifestations.tongueCoat: Little or None and often Dry
manifestations.pulse: Thin and hard and may be Rapid
